results.title: Eden
results.brief_description: Eden is an old growth forest in the Mount Kosciusko region of N.S.W.’s South-East that is still being logged today. Benjamin Cruse, the narator and member of Eden Land Council, tells of the efforts being made to save the remainder of the forest from total devastation. An Aboriginal man whose ancestors belonged to the region, Cruz describes the logging companies attitude towards the land as being connected and the same to the attitude of the ‘settlers’ toward indigenous people. The Aboriginal relationship with the land in Australia is described as being the ‘original human relationship’, the land is where the spirit is born and returns to upon death.

results.creator_credit: Truman Talley and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Cinemagazine showing various outdoor recreation in Hawaii: net fishing from the rocky shores; mud sliding; arm wrestling; gymnastics; rugby; horseback riding along Honolulu’s shoreline; sailing; surfing; outrigger canoes.

results.title: Ecotourism: an experience with nature
results.creator_credit: Ben Cropp, Ben Cropp Productions and Seven Network Limited (Australia)
results.brief_description: What does the word “ecotourism” mean? By visiting some of Australia’s most exotic national parks, this program explains the concept. Resort owners and tour operators are attempting to provide quality experiences for tourists interested in nature without subjecting the local environment to the damage normally associated with tourism.

results.title: Ecosystems and interactions
results.creator_credit: David E. Barrow, Malcolm Otton and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australian Ecology Series”.
Describes the communities of organisms in ecosystems and explains how they interact with one another and the environment in which they live. Ecosystems are inescapably locked together through nutrient cycles and food chains with a common denominator - the sun - as a source of all energy

results.title: Ecosystems
results.creator_credit: Robin Wischusen, ABC-TV (Australia) and Victorian College of Agriculture and Horticulture
results.brief_description:
Episode number 10 of Series “Growing awareness: Factors in plant production”.
Growers face conflicting interests - the need to grow plants economically and the need to ensure against long-term destructive environmental consequences. Four case studies feature four different ecosystems: 1. Managing a National Park - preserving the natural features while allowing public access 2. Agro-forestry - the combination of timber production and agriculture 3. Parwan Valley - where a local Landcare group is working to restore the environmental balance 4. An Urban Bushland environment.

results.title: Economies in transition (NP)
results.creator_credit: Ashley Schwall-Kearney, Craig Saunders, ABC-TV (Australia), Monash University and Open Learning Agency of Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode number 11 of Series “The Global Economy”.
This episode of the Open Learning Economics course examines the development of free market economic systems in the former communist states of Eastern Europe. The first episode looks at the emergence of liberal capitalism in Russia. The episode examines the benefits of opening Russia’s markets to the rest of the globe though it acknowledges that this embracement of capitalism, at an accelerated pace, has the potential to create devastating divisions based on wealth. The second episode looks at the success of capitalism in Poland which turned away from State Socialism in the early 1980s. In interviews with economists and Polish business people we are given an insight into some of the difficulties involved in dismantling a socialist economic system and replacing it with a market open to the international capitalist economy.
